newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian parliament passes bill on telecom panel.
newsitem.headline: Indian parliament passes bill on telecom panel.

text.p: The Indian parliament on Thursday approved a law seeking to replace a presidential decree to create an independent telecom regulatory panel, government statement said.
The law will replace the ordinance which was issued last January, the statement said.
"The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) will enjoy a substantial measure of autonomy. The Department of Telecommunications will come within its purview," it added.
The upper house of the parliament or Rajya Sabha approved the law on Thursday, after it had been passed by the lower house or Lok Sabha on Tuesday.
The TRAI will regulate the telecommunications industry, particularly basic telephone services, which India opened up to the private sector under an economic reforms programme launched in 1991.

The regulator is expected to resolve disputes between telephone service companies, ensure technical compatibility and inter-connectivity between them, regulate tariffs and protect consumer interests and competition.
